name: Sarah Nakato
bio: After completing my 2-year Master's in Engineering AI at CMU Africa, I joined Google's ML team where I work on improving search algorithms. My journey through the 4-semester MSEAI program gave me a strong foundation in deep learning and production ML systems, which prepared me perfectly for the technical interviews. The transition from Kigali to Zurich was challenging but rewarding.
journey: Focused on advanced machine learning courses across 4 semesters and completed a thesis on transformer architectures. Interned at a Kigali-based AI startup during my second year before landing a Google internship in my final semester, which led to a full-time offer.

name: James Omondi
bio: I'm now leading the development of cloud infrastructure solutions at Microsoft's African Innovation Center. My 2-year MSIT degree from CMU Africa gave me both the technical depth and practical experience needed to excel in distributed systems. I chose to stay in Africa to contribute to the growing tech ecosystem.
journey: Focused heavily on software architecture and distributed computing courses over 4 semesters. Completed my master's thesis on scalable cloud systems, which caught Microsoft's attention. Joined Microsoft immediately after graduation.

name: Amina Hassan
bio: I transitioned from software engineering to product management after realizing my passion for solving user problems and business strategy. The 2-year MSIT program at CMU Africa, with its emphasis on practical software systems and collaborative projects, taught me how to work across disciplinesâ€”crucial for PM roles.
journey: Completed the 4-semester MSIT program with electives in HCI and software product design. Participated in hackathons and startup competitions which sparked my interest in product management. Did a PM internship at a Kigali fintech startup during my second year.

name: David Kamau
bio: Working on cutting-edge robotics at Boston Dynamics. My 2-year MSECE degree from CMU Africa, with advanced coursework in control systems and embedded AI, prepared me perfectly for this role. The rigorous 4-semester curriculum and hands-on hardware projects were invaluable.
journey: Took a balanced approach between hardware and software courses across the 4-semester MSECE program. Completed my thesis on autonomous navigation systems. Applied for PhD programs but got a direct industry offer from Boston Dynamics that was too good to pass up.

name: Fatima Diallo
bio: Specializing in threat detection and incident response at Kaspersky. The 2-year MSIT program's advanced security courses and hands-on CTF competitions gave me the practical skills needed in cybersecurity. The collaborative learning environment helped me develop the problem-solving skills essential for security work.
journey: Focused on the security track within the 4-semester MSIT program. Joined the security club, participated in CTF competitions, and did internships focused on network security during my second year. Completed my master's thesis on ML-based intrusion detection and got certified in ethical hacking before graduation.

name: Michael Banda
bio: Founded an AI-powered agritech startup that helps smallholder farmers optimize crop yields using machine learning and satellite imagery. The 2-year MSEAI program at CMU Africa provided both the technical AI expertise and exposure to entrepreneurship that gave me the confidence to start my own company right after graduation.
journey: Combined advanced AI courses with entrepreneurship electives across 4 semesters. Worked on my startup idea as my master's thesis project. Participated in startup incubators in Kigali. Raised seed funding in my final semester and launched immediately after graduation.

name: Grace Mwangi
bio: Building payment infrastructure for the internet at Stripe. The 2-year MSIT program at CMU Africa emphasized both software engineering theory and hands-on practice, which has been crucial in understanding complex distributed systems at scale.
journey: Focused on software architecture and took advanced courses in databases, web systems, and distributed computing over 4 semesters. Did two internships during my program - one at a Kigali tech company and one at Stripe, which led to my full-time offer.

name: Ibrahim Nkurunziza
bio: Using data science to inform policy decisions on sustainable development in Africa. My 2-year MSIT degree with a focus on data analytics and ML prepared me for this unique role at the intersection of technology and international development.
journey: Combined software and data engineering courses with statistics electives over 4 semesters. Completed my master's thesis on data-driven development with CMU Africa faculty. Interned at the World Bank through a fellowship program during my second year, which opened doors for a permanent position.
